metadata.title: CVE-2022-1116 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
Integer Overflow or Wraparound vulnerability in io_uring of Linux Kernelallows local attacker to cause memory corruption and escalate privileges toroot. This issue affects: Linux Kernel versions prior to 5.4.189; version5.4.24 and later versions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1116` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-kvm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-aws-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.105').
linux-gcp: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
